intro: Androsace carnea var. cantabrica, commonly known as the Cantabrian pink rockrose, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine, white pubescence. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
